post_title: FT: 50 ungraded, one dozen graded, with Tolstois, Joe D.
post_content:
See this post for scans of the 60 ungraded.
See post 4 for scans of the Tolstois and Joe D.  I am taking these out of my collection and would trade them for Cycles or American Beauty backs, or anything, really, that I find attractive.

I'm most interested in raw cards for my binder collection--off-backs preferred, but all backs considered--commons G-VG or better, as-I'm continually upgrading and expanding.
I'll trade for graded cards other than commons as well.

If interested, PM me with your email address and/or I'll send you mine.

Note on the scans: As the page turns, the backs are in reverse order.

Ungraded, with my unofficial, estimated grade:

JENNINGS, one hand, SC 460/42 OP, G,--SOLD--
WHEAT, SC460/42, G, --TRADED--
LAJOIE, Piedmont 150/25, G [presents better, but has specks of paper-loss on back].--TRADED--

Southern Leaguers:

Hart, Piedmont, G-VG [Howe McCormick stamp on back],
Rockenfeld, Piedmont, G-VG,--TRADED--
Thebo, Old Mill, Fair,
Revelle, Old Mill, Poor,
Foster, Old Mill, Poor,--TRADED--
Manion, Old Mill, Poor.--TRADED--

Herzog, standing, Piedmont, G [Howe McCormick stamp on back],
Burch, Piedmont, G-,
J.J. Clarke, SC 150/649 OP, VG,
Elberfeld, Piedmont, VG,
Wiltse, SC 350/30, G-VG,
McQuillan, SC350/30,
Donlin batting, SC 350/30, Fair, 
McIntyre, E95, VG,--TRADED--
Elberfeld, SC460/25, G+,
Konetchy fielding, SC 460/25, G,
Bell, follow through, SC460/30, G-VG, faint, partial name on top--TRADED--
Bell, follow through, SC460/30, G,
Karger, Piedmont, G,
Barbeau, Piedmont, G-VG,--TRADED--
Jones, throwing, St.L, Piedmont, G-VG [Howe McCormick stamp on back], 
Arellanes, Piedmont, G,
Hoffman, St. L, SC 350/30, F-G,
Dooin, Piedmont, Fair [Howe McCormick stamp on back],
Schirm, Piedmont, Fair+,
Dorner, Piedmont 350/25,
Killian portrait, Piedmont 350/25, Back-stamp: GWT--TRADED--
McGraw, finger, SC150/25, good beater
TRADED—GRIFFITH batting, Piedmont 350/25, Poor, specks of paper-loss on back.
Ball, Clev, hands at chest, SC 460/25, Poor,

McGRAW, Piedmont [Howe McCormick stamp on back], I don't like bottom border; otherwise VG--TRADED--,
Donovan portrait, Old Mill, presents well, but I'd say trimmed on top, --TRADED--
Murphy batting SC 460/25, G-VG, [miscut?  measures short]
Hoffman, Providence, Polar Bear, [G, I suspect top border],
Jones, St.L., SC 150/30 [Uneven cut on bottom border. I think it's trimmed].
Schlei batting, Old Mill [miscut?  measures short],
Bay, Piedmont 350/25 [SL], trimmed/clipped corners, no apparent creases.

Camnitz, arms extended, Tolstoi, Poor [recent addition, not pictured]

Graded cards:

SC 350-460/25:
Bergen catching, SGC 40,
Dougherty, arm in air, SGC 40,
Lake, StL, ball in hand, SGC 40,
McGRAW, portrait, with cap, SGC 40,
Red Murray, portrait, SGC 20,
Herzog, in sweater, PSA 3,
Stovall batting, SGC 20,
Kleinow, Catching, Bos, PSA 2 [Mk--"INSURGENT 9" back-stamp. Boston/SP]
Schlei batting, SGC 55.

Lefty Leifeld, striped sleeves, Old Mill, PSA 1
Bill Dahlen, Brooklyn [SP], Piedmont 350/25, PSA 2,
McGRAW, glove on hip, SC 460/42, BVG 2.5
Josh Clark, SC 350/25, SGC 50,
Hal Chase, SC 350/25, SGC 30,
Molly Miller [SL], Old Mill, SC 20

Doug, just sent you an email….

Hope all is well! 
Jeff

post_title: I'll give this one more shot.
9 Tolstois + Berk Ross Joe D. FT
post_content:
If Tolstois are still hot, I'd be willing to trade these for American Beauty or Cycle backs, or anything else that is attractive to me.

Rhoades--TRADED--
Chance--TRADED--
Bender--TRADED--
Hummell and Demmit --NO LONGER AVAILABLE--
